metadata.Title: CVE-2019-9877 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description: There is an invalid memory access vulnerability in the function TextPage::findGaps() located at TextOutputDev.c in Xpdf 4.01, which can (for example) be triggered by sending a crafted pdf file to the pdftops binary. It allows an attacker to cause Denial of Service (Segmentation fault) or possibly have unspecified other impact.

notes.Note: jdstrand> xpdf in koffice is 2.0 mdeslaur> can't reproduce with poppler, no indication it is affected ebarretto> since 0.5.12-1 libextractor does not use xpdf anymore. xpdf in Debian uses poppler, which doesn't contain the vulnerable code

criterions.comment: ipe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
libextractor: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
poppler: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
xpdf: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
